intro: Lessingia micradenia var. glabrata, commonly known as the smoothleaf lessingia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae, which includes many species of flowering plants characterized by their showy flowers and often succulent leaves. The plant is typically found in rocky or sandy soils in arid or semi-arid environments. It produces small, pink to purple flowers that bloom in the spring, and its leaves are usually smooth and narrow. This variety is distinguished by its reduced leaf hair compared to other varieties of Lessingia micradenia.
